rows.text:
Welcome to Module 1: One-on-one time with your child!

In Module 1, as a facilitator, you need to achieve four things:

1️⃣ Introduce the MaPaChat program to families.
2️⃣ Establish rules.
3️⃣ Help parents think about and describe their goals for the family.
4️⃣ Discuss and practice One-on-One Time with participants.

text.eng:
Welcome to Module 1: One-on-one time with your child!

In Module 1, as a facilitator, you need to achieve four things:

1️⃣ Introduce the MaPaChat program to families.
2️⃣ Establish rules.
3️⃣ Help parents think about and describe their goals for the family.
4️⃣ Discuss and practice One-on-One Time with participants.

rows.text: Send this message to parents via SMS/text messaging as a reminder for the first session

text.eng: Send this message to parents via SMS/text messaging as a reminder for the first session

rows.text: Deliver Module 1 using the Facilitator Guide below:

text.eng: Deliver Module 1 using the Facilitator Guide below:

rows.text:
Welcome to Module 2: Talking about feelings! 

The main goal is for parents to learn  and  practice  talking  about  their  own  feelings  and  their  child's  feelings.

Parents will also learn: 
1️⃣ the  importance  of  accepting,  naming,  and  recognizing  the  different  emotions  their  child  is  feeling
2️⃣ ways  and  skills  that  can  help  with  this.

text.eng:
Welcome to Module 2: Talking about feelings! 

The main goal is for parents to learn  and  practice  talking  about  their  own  feelings  and  their  child's  feelings.

Parents will also learn: 
1️⃣ the  importance  of  accepting,  naming,  and  recognizing  the  different  emotions  their  child  is  feeling
2️⃣ ways  and  skills  that  can  help  with  this.

rows.text:
**Day One: Group Chat Session**

Estimate: One hour 

This  is  a  group  discussion  that  you  are  leading.  Remember  to  pause  after  each  step  to  provide  parents  with opportunity  to  respond  or  talk  to  group  members  if  comfortable them  to  do  this.

text.eng:
**Day One: Group Chat Session**

Estimate: One hour 

This  is  a  group  discussion  that  you  are  leading.  Remember  to  pause  after  each  step  to  provide  parents  with opportunity  to  respond  or  talk  to  group  members  if  comfortable them  to  do  this.

rows.text_2:
**Before You Get Started**

1️⃣ Review messages from your previous chat. Take note of parents who may need additional support.

2️⃣ Review the feedback from the previous module. Select a success that can be linked to the foundations in the live chat.

3️⃣ Choose a challenge that the group can work together to solve in the live chat.
rows.text:
Welcome to Module 2: Talking about feelings! 

The main goal is to help parents talk about their own feelings and their child's feelings.  

Parents will also learn:  

1️⃣ How to notice, name, and accept their child's feelings.  
2️⃣ Simple skills to help with this.

text.eng:
Welcome to Module 2: Talking about feelings! 

The main goal is to help parents talk about their own feelings and their child's feelings.  

Parents will also learn:  

1️⃣ How to notice, name, and accept their child's feelings.  
2️⃣ Simple skills to help with this.

rows.text_2:
**Chat Session Outline**

1: Greetings & Welcome
2: Discussion: Burial Work
3: Sharing Success
4: Sharing the Challenge
5: Discussion: Challenges & Solutions
6: Introducing MaPa Skill: Talking About Feelings
7: Comics: Conversation About Feelings (Children)
8: Discussion About Comics
9: Comics: Talking About Feelings (Teenage Son)
10: Discussion About Comics
11: Discussion: Considering the Child’s Age in Conversations
12: Discussion: Reasons for Talking About Feelings
13: Setting a Home Activity or Homework
14: Clarification Video: MaPa Skill Reminder
15: Audio Reminder: Pause for a Moment
16: Gratitude & Closing
rows.text:
**Day 1: Group Chat Session**

⏲️: One hour 
⏸️: Pause  after  each  message shared  to  provide  parents  with opportunity  to  respond  or  talk  to  other group  members.

text.eng:
**Day 1: Group Chat Session**

⏲️: One hour 
⏸️: Pause  after  each  message shared  to  provide  parents  with opportunity  to  respond  or  talk  to  other group  members.

rows.text:
**Memory Refresh**

In the last module, you taught parents how to establish One-on-One time with their children with these building blocks: 

1️⃣ DAY- Try to do this every day.
Set aside 5 minutes (or more!) each day for One-on-One Time with your child.

2️⃣ PLAY - Let them choose what to do.
Tell your child that you have time for One-on-One Time with them, and they can choose what they want to do or what they want to talk about. They may be hesitant at first, but eventually they will look forward to spending time with you!

3️⃣ STAY- Give your child your full attention.
Turn off the TV and put away the cell phone. Look at your child. Nod or say “I see” to show that you are paying full attention. Show interest in his story and accept what he says without judgment.

text.eng:
**Memory Refresh**

In the last module, you taught parents how to establish One-on-One time with their children with these building blocks: 

1️⃣ DAY- Try to do this every day.
Set aside 5 minutes (or more!) each day for One-on-One Time with your child.

2️⃣ PLAY - Let them choose what to do.
Tell your child that you have time for One-on-One Time with them, and they can choose what they want to do or what they want to talk about. They may be hesitant at first, but eventually they will look forward to spending time with you!

3️⃣ STAY- Give your child your full attention.
Turn off the TV and put away the cell phone. Look at your child. Nod or say “I see” to show that you are paying full attention. Show interest in his story and accept what he says without judgment.
